headline: Lives in Contradiction: Albert Camus & Marcus Aurelius
description: A Plutarchian inversion via dialogue — contrasting Camus and Aurelius not as historical biographies but as living ideas. This piece is part of a recursive series on contradiction, virtue, and inner revolt.
whyItMatters: This piece dramatizes the tension between two worldviews: one that endures the absurd with private strength, and one that defies the void through revolt. It doesn’t resolve — it illuminates by contrast.
articleExcerpt: This is the latest installment of Lives in Contradiction, a series that offers a Plutarchian inversion...
